doc.field: Longfellow, Henry Wadsworth: Cambridge & Nahant, MA
Longfellow, Henry Wadsworth: Cambridge & Nahant, MA
1874 July 22; 1877 June 18; 1878 March 29; 1879 January 20; undated, circa 1870s
Addressed To: "J.J. Fields, 148 Charles Street, Boston," [MA] ; "Professor E.N. [Eben Norton] Horsford, Esq., [27] Craigie Street," [Cambridge, MA], "Shelter Island, NY"
Sent From: "H.W.L. / Henry W. [Wadsworth] Longfellow, Camb. [Cambridge] / Nahant," [MA]
In Reference To: Friendship / Personal / Social / Travel; Mr. Greene

Henry Wadsworth Longfellow (February 27, 1807 â€“ March 24, 1882) was an American educator and poet whose works include "Paul Revere's Ride," The Song of Hiawatha and Evangeline. Longfellow was also one of the five Fireside Poets, and the first American to translate Dante Alighieri's The Divine Comedy. Longfellow archival material is preserved at many repositories including but not limited to the Bowdoin Library in Brunswick, ME, the Harvard College Library in Cambridge, MA, the Longfellow National Historic Site in Cambridge, MA, and the New York Public Library in New York, NY.
